title: MacBook Pro 16" - 820-01700-A - 5V / 0.02A dead after connecting USB-C docking station
message:
Hey!

History for the board:

water damaged / on top of the case 
replaced U3500 + Q3501 - board was working fine

-> usb-c docking station connected on the side of the water damage -> dead -> 5V / 0.02A


ppbus_g3h is 0V


should i just replace the CD3217 or where to start to troubleshoot?

title: MacBook Pro 16" - 820-01700-A - 5V / 0.02A dead after connecting USB-C docking station
message:
Diode mode to ground on PPBUS_G3H?
Also check diode mode around CD3217 chips.

Any voltage at R7020?

title: MacBook Pro 16" - 820-01700-A - 5V / 0.02A dead after connecting USB-C docking station
message:
diode mode beeps on ppbus_g3h / 0

R7020 all 4 pins, 5V

title: MacBook Pro 16" - 820-01700-A - 5V / 0.02A dead after connecting USB-C docking station
message:
I guess you meant "beeps".
Check if you get the same reading to ground on any big coil.

title: MacBook Pro 16" - 820-01700-A - 5V / 0.02A dead after connecting USB-C docking station
message:
yep, everything beeps

C3500 looks like shit, beeps too

title: MacBook Pro 16" - 820-01700-A - 5V / 0.02A dead after connecting USB-C docking station
message:
Please, STOP to diagnose by beeps!!!
Check resistance in ohm scale.

BTW, multimeters beep untill 0.050-0.070, depending by model.

title: MacBook Pro 16" - 820-01700-A - 5V / 0.02A dead after connecting USB-C docking station
message:
okay.

resistance is 0.02 / 0.03 OHM, almost nothing

title: MacBook Pro 16" - 820-01700-A - 5V / 0.02A dead after connecting USB-C docking station
message:
Where do you get such short?
Please post accurate information...

title: MacBook Pro 16" - 820-01700-A - 5V / 0.02A dead after connecting USB-C docking station
message: this is the resistance to ground on ppbus_g3h...

title: MacBook Pro 16" - 820-01700-A - 5V / 0.02A dead after connecting USB-C docking station
MacBook Pro 16" - 820-01700-A - 5V / 0.02A dead after connecting USB-C docking station
message:
Do you get the same resistamce to ground on any big coil?
Like the ones for CPU?

title: MacBook Pro 16" - 820-01700-A - 5V / 0.02A dead after connecting USB-C docking station
message: on C658X? yes. can you tell me where to measure?

title: MacBook Pro 16" - 820-01700-A - 5V / 0.02A dead after connecting USB-C docking station
message:
CPU core voltage is on L7211/21/31.
Also check on L7410/20 (iGPU core).
Compare ohm readings with the value on PPBUS_G3H.

title: MacBook Pro 16" - 820-01700-A - 5V / 0.02A dead after connecting USB-C docking station
message:
3 - 3.2 OHM on L7211/21/31

7 OHM on L7410/20

0.3 OHM at ppbus_g3h

title: MacBook Pro 16" - 820-01700-A - 5V / 0.02A dead after connecting USB-C docking station
message:
If no other coils give you same 0.3 ohm to ground, then is safe to inject voltage into PPBUS_G3H.
Start with 1V and increase slowly, if needed.
Set the amp limit on PSU to max.

First be sure you've checked all the coils; don't forget L9080/580.

title: MacBook Pro 16" - 820-01700-A - 5V / 0.02A dead after connecting USB-C docking station
message: Q3501 was causing short - crazy. this was a new chip. replaced with new one and its running.

title: MacBook Pro 16" - 820-01700-A - 5V / 0.02A dead after connecting USB-C docking station
message: If pin 1 isn't properly soldered, MOSFET gets burnt when apply power on the board.
